org.openimaj.video

Class VideoDisplay.BasicVideoTimeKeeper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.video.VideoDisplay.BasicVideoTimeKeeper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, TimeKeeper<Timecode>
    Enclosing class:
    VideoDisplay<T extends Image<?,T>>

    public class VideoDisplay.BasicVideoTimeKeeper
extends Object
implements TimeKeeper<Timecode>
    A timekeeper for videos without audio - uses the system time to keep track of where in a video a video should be. Also used for live videos that are to be displayed at a given rate.
    Version:
    $Author$, $Revision$, $Date$
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
    Created:
    14 Aug 2012

      • supportsPause

        public boolean supportsPause()
        Returns whether the timekeeper supports pausing. If the timekeeper supports pausing then a stop() followed by a run() will continue from where the timekeeper was paused. Use reset() inbetween to force the timekeeper to start from the beginning again.
        Specified by:
        supportsPause in interface TimeKeeper<Timecode>
        Returns:
        TRUE if the timekeeper supports pausing.
        See Also:
        TimeKeeper.supportsPause()

      • supportsSeek

      • setTimeOffset

        public void setTimeOffset(long timeOffset)
        Set the time offset to use in the current time calculation. Can be used to force the time keeper to start at a different point in time.
        Parameters:
        timeOffset - the new time offset.
